wikipedia_page.main: James Michael Davies (born 27 February 1980) is a British Conservative Party politician and Member of Parliament for the Vale of Clwyd. Davies held the seat from 2015 to 2017, before regaining the seat again in 2019.

response: *James Davies (Welsh Conservatives) in Vale of Clwyd, first elected in 2019.

He lost his seat to Conservative James Davies in the 2015 General Election. However, he successfully stood for re-election in the Vale of Clwyd constituency in the 2017 election. before losing it again.
In 2019 he again lost his seat to Conservative James Davies in the General Election in December of that year.

The Vale of Clwyd () is a constituency of the House of Commons of the UK Parliament created in 1997 and represented since 2019 by James Davies of the Conservative Party. As with all extant seats its electorate elect one Member of Parliament (MP) by the first past the post system at least every five years.

response: The advisory board is made up of Conservative and Independent political figures.  Conservative Members of Parliament on the board include: David Jones, deputy chairman of the European Research Group; James Davies and Sarah Atherton. Patrick Minford, professor at Cardiff University, is also on the board.
